name: AWS EC2 instances with Public IP and associated with Security Groups have Internet Access
description: This policy identifies AWS EC2 instances with Public IP and associated with Security Groups have Internet Access. EC2 instance receives a public IP address when launched in a default VPC security group (A security group acts as a virtual firewall for your instance to control inbound and outbound traffic.) and we don't assign a public IP address to instances launched in a non-default subnet. Therefore it's a best practice to ensure that there are no EC2 instances with Public IP that are associated with Security Groups which have Internet Access.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where api.name = 'aws-ec2-describe-instances' as X; config from cloud.resource where api.name = 'aws-ec2-describe-security-groups' as Y; filter '($.X.publicIpAddress exists and $.X.publicIpAddress is not empty) and (($.X.securityGroups[*].groupName==$.Y.groupName) and ($.Y.ipPermissions[*].ipRanges[*] contains 0.0.0.0/0 or $.Y.ipPermissions[*].ipv6Ranges[*].cidrIpv6 contains ::/0))'; show X;
recommendation:
It is recommended to avoid using Public IP address and associate your EC2 instance with Elastic IP instead.

A. To allocate an Elastic IP address for use in EC2-Classic/EC2-VPC using the console
1. Sign into the AWS console
2. Go to EC2 console
3. In the navigation pane, choose Elastic IPs
4. Click 'Allocate new address'
5. Click Associate

B. To associate an Elastic IP address with an instance using the console.

1. Sign into the AWS console
2. Go to EC2 console
3. In the navigation pane, choose Elastic IPs
4. Select an Elastic IP address and choose Actions, Associate address
5. Select the instance from Instance and then choose Associate.
6. Click Associate

C. To restrict Security Groups allowing all traffic, follow the instructions below:

1. Log in to the AWS console and navigate to the 'VPC' service
2. Click on the 'Security Group' specific to the alert
3. Click on 'Inbound Rules' and remove the row with the IP value as 0.0.0.0/0 or ::/0
